text: The Champaign–Urbana metropolitan area, also known as Champaign–Urbana and Urbana–Champaign as well as Chambana, is a metropolitan area in east-central Illinois. The metropolitan area has a population of 235,608 as of the 2023 estimate. The area is made up of Champaign and Urbana. It is home to the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. The metropolitan area is also made up of Champaign County, Piatt County, and Ford County. From 2018 to 2023, Ford County was not considered a part of the metropolitan area. ==References== Category:Metropolitan areas of the United States Category:Geography of Illinois
title: Champaign–Urbana metropolitan area
